snippet: Residents of Priory Hall, the most notorious of Ireland’s ruined ghost developments, are in legal limbo, barred from living in homes that they still have to pay for.
abstract: Dublin Journal; residents of Priory Hall in Dublin, the most notorious of Ireland’s ruined ghost developments, are in legal limbo, barred from living in homes that they still have to pay the mortgage for; officials declared complex a fire hazard and forced its inhabitants to leave in October 2011; those residents are high-profile casualties of the corruption and recklessness of the Irish housing boom in the 2000s.
lead_paragraph: Residents of Priory Hall, the most notorious of Ireland’s ruined ghost developments, are in legal limbo, barred from living in homes that they still have to pay for.

headline.seo: In Ruined Apartments, Symbol of Ireland’s Fall
headline.main: In Ruined Apartments, a Symbol of Ireland’s Fall
headline.print_headline: In Ruined Apartments, a Symbol of Ireland’s Fall
